countries.name: Kazakhstan
countries.interesting_fact: Kazakhstan is the largest landlocked country in the world.
countries.description: Kazakhstan, located in Central Asia, is known for its vast steppes, rich natural resources, and diverse cultural heritage.

countries.name: Kyrgyzstan
countries.interesting_fact: The Tian Shan mountain range covers about 80% of the country.
countries.description: Kyrgyzstan is a mountainous country in Central Asia, renowned for its stunning natural landscapes and nomadic culture.

countries.name: Tajikistan
countries.interesting_fact: Tajikistan is home to the world's second-highest dam, the Nurek Dam.
countries.description: Tajikistan, with its rugged terrain and rich history, is known for its scenic mountains and ancient cultural heritage.

countries.name: Turkmenistan
countries.interesting_fact: The Karakum Desert occupies about 70% of Turkmenistan's territory.
countries.description: Turkmenistan is a country in Central Asia with vast deserts and a significant natural gas industry, known for its unique cultural practices.

countries.name: Uzbekistan
countries.economy: Cotton production, gold mining, natural gas, automotive manufacturing
countries.interesting_fact: Uzbekistan is one of the world's top producers of cotton.
countries.description: Uzbekistan is a culturally rich country in Central Asia, famous for its historic cities like Samarkand and Bukhara, which were key points on the Silk Road.

countries.name: Afghanistan
countries.interesting_fact: Afghanistan is known for its diverse ethnic groups and has a rich history influenced by various civilizations.
countries.description: Afghanistan, located at the crossroads of Central and South Asia, has a complex history and diverse culture, with significant natural and historical landmarks.
